issue.title: Release schedule for 0.19.0
issue.body:
Here is a proposed release schedule for 0.19.0, the next major release of Bitcoin Core. Like for previous major releases I've aimed for a release 6 months after the last ( #14438).

2019-09-01 :heavy_check_mark: 
---------------
- Open Transifex translations for 0.19
- Soft translation string freeze (no large or unnecessary string changes until release)
- Finalize and close translations for 0.17

2019-09-15 :heavy_check_mark: 
---------------
- Feature freeze (bug fixes only until release)
- Translation string freeze (no more source language changes until release)

2019-10-01 :heavy_check_mark: 
---------------
- Split off `0.19` branch from `master`
- Start RC cycle, tag and release `0.19.0rc1`
- Start merging for 0.20 on master branch

2019-11-03 :heavy_check_mark:
---------------
- Release 0.19.0 final (aim)

If any specific dates or timeframes are a problem for you, let me know.

**Edit:** schedule was moved two months back on 2019-05-07, for reference, the old schedule was:
```
2019-11-01    Soft translation string freeze
2019-11-15    Feature freeze
2019-12-01    Split off 0.19 branch from master
2020-01-03    Release 0.19.0 final (aim)
```

events.body:
@moneyball correctly remarked that these dates start off the process at the projected release date (6 months after 0.18.0, so, 2019-11-01) instead of aiming to do the release then. Should we move this this schedule two months back?
```
2019-09-01    Soft translation string freeze
2019-09-15    Feature freeze
2019-10-01    Split off 0.19 branch from master
2019-11-03    Release 0.19.0 final (aim)
```

> Should we move this this schedule two months back?

> Should we move this this schedule two months back?

ACK
Are we going to translate this  via [transifex](https://www.transifex.com/bitcoin/)
@laanwj I wanted to let you know I let you a message on transifex regarding 0.19 - just in case you wouldn't notice. Thanks
I have supplemented the translation of Chinese (Taiwan) (zh_TW) and Chinese (China) (zh_CN) on transifex.

rc1 binaries are up, and have been announced on the bitcoin-core-dev mailing list

https://bitcoincore.org/bin/bitcoin-core-0.19.0/test.rc1/
https://lists.linuxfoundation.org/pipermail/bitcoin-core-dev/2019-October/000082.html
